00010 ## This unit testing class is built around the "unittest" module.
00011 #@class p_engine_tester
00012 class p_engine_tester(unittest.TestCase):
00013     ## Instantiates variables needed for testing
00014     # @param self
00015     def setUp(self):
00016         self.pengine = p_engine.Pengine([3],3,".",.5)
00017         self.atom = self.pengine.Atom('111.111.111.111',80,'tcp',0)
00018     ## Cleans up after testing is complete
00019     # @param self
00020     def tearDown(self):
00021         self.atom = None
00022         self.pengine = None

00024     #One test per method in p_engine.py

00026     ## Tests the Pengine __init__ method.
00027     # Does not test valididty of parser object
00028     # Test cases (frame_sizes, max_atoms, path): \n
00029     # Case 1: [1], 1, "" \n
00030     # Case 2: [9,1,4,7], 1, "" \n
00031     # Case 3: [8,5,3,10], 5, "" \n
00032     # Case 4: [1,4,3], 4, "./test_data"
00033     # @param self
00034     def test_Pengine(self):
00035         self.Pengine_helper([1], 1, "")
00036         self.Pengine_helper([9,1,4,7], 1, "")
00037         self.Pengine_helper([8,5,3,10], 5, "")
00038         self.Pengine_helper([1,4,3], 4, "./test_data")
00039         
00040     ## Helper method for test_Pengine.
00041     # Checks whether Pengine initial values have been set properly.
00042     # @param self, frame_sizes, max_atoms, path
00043     # @returns true or false, signifying validity of created Pengine
00044     def Pengine_helper(self, f, m, p):
00045         pengine = self.pengine
00046         pengine = p_engine.Pengine(f, m, p,.5)
00047         assert pengine.t_0 == 0, 't_0'
00048         assert pengine.t_1 == 10000, 't_1'
00049         assert pengine.max_frame_size == max(f), 'max_frame_size'
00050         assert pengine.frame_sizes == f, 'frame_sizes'
00051         assert pengine.atom_list == [], 'atom_list'
00052         assert pengine.bitmaps == {}, 'bitmaps'
00053         assert pengine.id_list == [], 'id_list'
00054         assert pengine.max_ids == m, 'max_ids'
00055         
00056     ## Tests the Atom __init__ method.
00057     # Test cases (ip, port, protocol, timestamp):
00058     # Case 1: '111.111.111.111',80,'tcp',0
00059     # Case 2: '11.31.121.34',80,'tcp',-1
00060     # Case 3: 
00061     # Case 4: 
00062     # @param self
00063     def test_Atom(self):
00064         self.Atom_helper('111.111.111.111',80,'tcp',0)
00065         self.Atom_helper('11.31.121.34',80,'tcp',1)
00066         
00067     ## Helper method for test_Atom.
00068     # Checks whether Atom initial values have been set properly.
00069     # @param self, ip, port, protocol, timestamp
00070     # @returns true or false, signifying validity of created atom
00071     def Atom_helper(self, ip, prt, ptcl, ts):
00072         atom = self.atom
00073         self.pengine = p_engine.Pengine([1],10,"",.5)
00074         atom = self.pengine.Atom(ip,prt,ptcl,ts)
00075         assert atom.id == -1, 'id'
00076         assert atom.dest_ip == ip, 'dest_ip'
00077         assert atom.dest_port == prt, 'dest_port'
00078         assert atom.protocol == ptcl, 'protocol'
00079         assert atom.last_timestamp == ts, 'last_timestamp'
00080 
00081     ## Tests the getID method of Pengine.
00082     # Test cases:
00083     # Case 1: check empty list
00084     # Case 2: getting first ID
00085     # Case 3: getting second ID
00086     # Case 4: getting third ID
00087     # Case 5: getting ID > maxIDs
00088     # Case 5: getting ID > maxIDs + 1
00089     # @param self
00090     def test_getID(self):
00091         pengine = self.pengine
00092         assert pengine.id_list == [], 'check empty list'
00093         assert pengine.getID() == 0, 'first ID == 0'
00094         assert pengine.id_list == [0], 'list now == [0]'
00095         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,0]}, 'bitmap now == {0:[0,0,0]}'
00096         assert pengine.getID() == 1, 'second ID == 1'
00097         assert pengine.id_list == [1,0], 'list now == [1,0]'
00098         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0]}, 'bitmap now == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0]}'
00099         assert pengine.getID() == 2, 'third ID == 2'
00100         assert pengine.id_list == [2,1,0], 'list now == [2,1,0]'
00101         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}, 'bitmap now == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}'
00102         assert pengine.getID() == 0, 'third ID == 0'
00103         assert pengine.id_list == [0,2,1], 'list now == [0,2,1]'
00104         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}, 'bitmap now == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}'
00105         assert pengine.getID() == 1, 'fourth ID == 1'
00106         assert pengine.id_list == [1,0,2], 'list now == [1,0,2]'    
00107         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}, 'bitmap now == {0:[0,0,0], 1:[0,0,0], 2:[0,0,0]}'
00108 
00109     ## Tests the updateBitmap method of Pengine.
00110     # Test cases:
00111     # Case 1: check empty bitmap
00112     # Case 2: add one atom and check updated bitmap
00113     # Case 3: add second atom and check updated bitmap
00114     # @param self
00115     def test_updateBitmap(self):
00116         pengine = self.pengine;
00117         atom = self.atom
00118         assert pengine.bitmaps == {}, 'check empty bitmap'
00119         atom.id = pengine.getID()
00120         pengine.atom_list.append(atom)
00121         pengine.updateBitmap(atom)
00122         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,1]}
00123         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port,\
00124                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00125         atom_two.id = pengine.getID()
00126         pengine.atom_list.append(atom_two)
00127         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,1], 1:[0,0,0]}
00128         pengine.updateBitmap(atom_two)
00129         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,0,1], 1:[0,0,1]}
00130         pengine.cleanBitmap()
00131         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,1,0], 1:[0,1,0]}
00132         pengine.updateBitmap(atom)
00133         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,1,1], 1:[0,1,0]}
00134         pengine.updateBitmap(atom_two)
00135         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[0,1,1], 1:[0,1,1]}
00136         pengine.cleanBitmap()
00137         assert pengine.bitmaps == {0:[1,1,0], 1:[1,1,0]}
00138 
00139     ## Tests the timeIncrement method of Pengine.
00140     # Test cases (timestamps):
00141     # Case 1: 10000 (hours place . . .)
00142     # Case 2: 10412 (. . . with mmss nonzero)
00143     # Case 3: 230412 (hour to day conversion . . .)
00144     # Case 4: 6230412 (. . . with days nonzero)
00145     # Case 5: 99230000 (wrap around . . .)
00146     # Case 6: 99230576 (. . . with mmss nonzero)
00147     # @param self
00148     def test_timeIncrement(self):
00149         for h in range(0,230000,10000):
00150             for m in range(0,5900,100):
00151                 for s in range(0,59):
00152                     if h == 230000 and mmss == 0:
00153                         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(h+m+s) == 240000, "230000 bumped"
00154                     elif h == 240000 and mmss == 0:
00155                         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(h+m+s) == 0, "day bumped"
00156                     elif h == 230000:
00157                         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(h+m+s) == m+s, "day bumped"
00158                     else:
00159                         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(h+m+s) == h+10000+m+s, "hour bumped"
00160         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(10000) == 20000, 'hours place'
00161         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(10412) == 20412, 'with mmss != 0'
00162         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(230000) == 240000, 'wrap around'
00163         assert p_engine.timeIncrement(230576) == 576, 'wrap around w/ mmss'
00164 
00165     ## Tests the timeCheck method of Pengine.
00166     # Test cases:
00167     # Case Set A: t0 < t1
00168     # Case 1: a_time = t0
00169     # Case 2: t0 < a_time < t1
00170     # Case 3: a_time = t1
00171     # Case 4: a_time > t1
00172     # Case Set B: t1 < t0 (wrap around)
00173     # Case 1: a_time = t0
00174     # Case 2: a_time < t0 < t1
00175     # Case 3: a_time = t1
00176     # Case 4: t1 < a_time < t0
00177     # @param self
00178     def test_timeCheck(self):
00179         #self.resetEngine()
00180         pengine = self.pengine
00181         atom = self.atom
00182         pengine.window_size = 10000
00183 
00184         # case 1: t0 < t1
00185         pengine.t_0 = 0
00186         pengine.t_1 = 10000
00187         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 'a_time = t0'
00188         atom.last_timestamp = int((pengine.t_0 + pengine.t_1) / 2)
00189         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 't0 < a_time < t1'
00190         atom.last_timestamp = int(pengine.t_1)
00191         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 'a_time = t1'
00192         atom.last_timestamp = int(pengine.t_1 + 10)
00193         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 1, 'a_time > t1'
00194         
00195         # case 2: t1 < t0 (wrap around)
00196         pengine.t_0 = 99235959
00197         pengine.t_1 = p_engine.timeIncrement(pengine.t_0)
00198         atom.last_timestamp =  int(pengine.t_0)
00199         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 'a_time = t0'
00200         atom.last_timestamp = int(pengine.t_1 - 10)
00201         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 'a_time < t0 < t1'
00202         atom.last_timestamp = int(pengine.t_1)
00203         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 0, 'a_time = t1'
00204         atom.last_timestamp = int(pengine.t_1 + 10)
00205         assert pengine.timeCheck(atom) == 1, 't1 < a_time < t0'
00206 
00207     ## Tests the compareAtoms method of Pengine.
00208     # Test cases:
00209     # Case 1: compare to self
00210     # Case 2: compare to equivalent atom
00211     # Case 3: compare to non-equivalent atom
00212     # Case 4: compare to self (using a different atom)
00213     # @param self
00214     def test_compareAtoms(self):
00215         #self.resetEngine()
00216         pengine = self.pengine
00217         atom = self.atom
00218         assert p_engine.compareAtoms(atom,atom) == 1, 'compare to self'
00219         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port,\
00220                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00221         assert p_engine.compareAtoms(atom,atom_two) == 1, 'compare to equivalent'
00222         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port-1,\
00223                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00224         assert p_engine.compareAtoms(atom,atom_two) == 0, 'compare to different'
00225         assert p_engine.compareAtoms(atom_two,atom_two) == 1, 'compare to self'
00226         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port,\
00227                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp+1)
00228         assert p_engine.compareAtoms(atom_two,atom) == 1, 'different timestamp'
00229 
00230     ## Tests the atomExists method of Pengine.
00231     # Test cases:
00232     # Case 1: empty atom list
00233     # Case 2: one atom exists
00234     # Case 3: second atom that has not been added
00235     # Case 4: second atom exists
00236     # @param self
00237     def test_atomExists(self):
00238         #self.resetEngine()
00239         pengine = self.pengine
00240         atom = self.atom
00241         assert pengine.atomExists(atom) == None, 'empty atom list'
00242         pengine.atom_list.append(atom)
00243         atom.id = pengine.getID()
00244         assert pengine.atomExists(atom) == atom, 'one atom exists'
00245         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port-1,\
00246                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00247         assert pengine.atomExists(atom_two) == None, 'unadded atom dne'
00248         pengine.atom_list.append(atom_two)
00249         atom_two.id = pengine.getID()
00250         assert pengine.atomExists(atom_two) == atom_two, 'second atom exists'
00251  
00252     ## Tests the addAtom method of Pengine.
00253     # Test cases:
00254     # Case 1: add first atom
00255     # Case 2: add same atom
00256     # Case 3: add equivalent atom (should not be added)
00257     # Case 4: add second unique atom
00258     # Case 5: add same atom
00259     # Case 6: add equivalent atom
00260     # @param self
00261     def test_addAtom(self):
00262         #self.resetEngine()
00263         pengine = self.pengine
00264         atom = self.atom
00265         assert pengine.addAtom(atom) == 1, 'add first atom'
00266         assert pengine.addAtom(atom) == 0, 'add same atom 1'
00267         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port,\
00268                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00269         assert pengine.addAtom(atom_two) == 0, 'add equivalent atom'
00270         atom_two = pengine.Atom(atom.dest_ip,atom.dest_port-1,\
00271                                  atom.protocol,atom.last_timestamp)
00272         assert pengine.addAtom(atom_two) == 1, 'add second unique atom'
00273         assert pengine.addAtom(atom_two) == 0, 'add same atom 2'
00274         atom = pengine.Atom(atom_two.dest_ip,atom_two.dest_port,\
00275                                  atom_two.protocol,atom_two.last_timestamp)
00276         assert pengine.addAtom(atom) == 0, 'add equivalent atom'
00277  
00278     ## End to end test of Pengine
00279     # @param self
00280     def test_end_to_end(self):
00281         self.pengine = p_engine.Pengine([10,24,48],10000,"../test_data/test_logs",.5)
00282         persistent_list = self.pengine.run()
00283         print "persistent atom count: ",
00284         print len(persistent_list)
00285         for a in persistent_list:
00286             print a.dest_ip
00287
